subject: Management
title: The Coordination Tax
description: A quick, practical guide to The Coordination Tax.

hook.text: A 12-person team spent 60% of their time in meetings coordinating. Only 40% was actual work.

buildup.text: Every dependency between people creates coordination overhead: handoffs, meetings, and waiting.

discovery.text: Fred Brooks' law: adding people to a late project makes it later. Communication costs explode.

twist.text: The solution isn't fewer meetings. It's fewer dependencies between people.

climax.text: Design work so people can progress independently. Reduce handoffs. Increase autonomy.

punchline.text: Cut dependencies, not meetings. Meetings are the symptom.

quiz.question: What is the coordination tax in teams?
options: Time spent managing handoffs and dependencies instead of producing work
The financial cost of project management software
Required meetings mandated by company policy
